content: Wonderful information - I hope the developers keep adding plants and info. I am in particularly interested in greenhouse plantings too. It's winter here... I will keep this updated.
The app is amazing,my only concern is that the harvest times aren't pretty accurate
It recently will not allow me to backup or restore my garden. I got a new phone and can't restore my garden. As a premium customer, no very happy. üòí
User friendly, and very resourceful. Plants not there? Well just add them according to your own references and growing conditions needs. This is the only garden app i will ever need! Thank you
Great, just needs more options like squash varieties, different melons, more flowers, potatoes, etc.
I am a medical ethnobotanist and LOVE this app. I do wish this was a bit more customizable but its the best next to seed to spoon

Over the last three months, I have been using this app to set up an allotment, and it has proved extremely useful. It allows me to track seeds I have planted indoors before transplanting them to the allotment, and provides lots of helpful information. I am making extensive use of the notes so I can look back at what I did. I use the bed layout diagram, though the configuration of my allotment is quite simple. The developer is very responsive and added a new feature requested within three weeks.
Easy to use and a very good guide in planting crops.
After a couple of weeks, the app lost all my plants. Now I've lost track of everything. What a waste of time and money this app!!!!
replyContent: Hi Marlene, thank you for trying out Gardroid! I'm sorry to see that your plants are gone. Can you please contact me through mail so I can help you out further? It's gardroid.app@gmail.com. Thanks in advance!

content: Like the app but wish I could sincranize with other devices. Added to a different phone and lost all my notes. Disappointing.
Makes gardening easy
Had problems downloading onto new phone but support took me through the process. Will update as I use it more.

I am still on the fence with the program. Mimicing my beds by adding/subtracting tiles is not going to be as exact as I hoped. I was hoping to stay within one program, not needing to use a pdf file of my layout as well. I saw the feature of watering the bed but I was more thinking about setting up an alert for watering the bed. I need an alert that tell's me to water a specific area of the garden. I played around with it and filled a bed with Cauliflower and then noticed I can make a custom watering alert from within the plant, called it bed 1-5 drip. But then after I saved it, I can't find the custom alert anywhere to edit and it doesn't show up anywhere in the program. It is not in the alerts of the Cauliflower. I did it twice, saved it. Where is it? But what I really need is a specific alert connected to beds, not vegetables. An alert I can find easily and edit if necessary, depending on the season. Thanks for tweaking the program, I appreciate it but like I said I am still on the fence. I like some features but still not convinced it will work for me
replyContent: Hi Isabell, thanks for your review! You can create other shapes than square beds if you want. Just add more or less tiles to a bed to mimic the layout of your garden. You can now water a bed by selecting it and tapping on the water icon. Or by zooming out in the Garden screen and using the water icon to water a bed. Good luck!

content: Great for vegetable but limited choice of flowers. I used the free version for the vegetables and thought it was the best app to have the timing of different tasks /harvesting as well as basic info. I bought the premium for the flowers (and also as I think that if an app is good I should reward the developers). I could transfer all the plants from the free version to the premium version. It would be good to increase the flowers list and add some other non flower ornamental plants.
replyContent: Hi Camille, thanks for your review! More plants will become available in the app, so the amount of flowers will increase. I hope they will be useful for you. Good luck with growing your plants!

content: Love the app. Very helpful with all required info in one easily accessible location. I immediately bought the premium version. 2 required features - ability to sync between 2 (or more) devices; ability to export full details to a desktop app or spreadsheet.
replyContent: Hi Gerry, thanks for your review and for buying the Premium version! I hope to include the features that you have requested one day in the app and to support more platforms. I'm sorry for any inconvenience for now. Good luck with growing your crops!

content: Top app... Well happy. Though I have noticed there is no sumac.... Small issue really.

I was looking for something like this instead of doing garden calendars by hand each season. I like how I can switch the order for 'my garden' to find the info I need and also that I can customize alerts or change harvest dates if the variety I have doesn't match with the default. Would like to see a seedling emerge date added to the my garden section when you click on a particular plant.
Excellent app and supprt

Nice app. Would be awesome if we could sync the planting and harvesting meter to zip codes or hardiness zones. There is a setting for first and last frost but no setting for maximum temps. The planting/harvest meter is a bit inaccurate for my zone and some of the plants it is telling me are good to plant will not survive due to high temps in spring and summer.

What an amazing app! I'm going to continue to find out things from it for a very long time. The developer is very quick & kind to answer any question. You know he has passion for both gardening and helping people. I had a little problem with "My Garden" yet reading his emails worked me thru it. I had been putting the horse before the cart sort of speak and trying to jump in too quickly into designing My Garden. You need to pick out your plants first, name the beds and then tap on the tiles. Duh!

Well thought out software and very versatile. Developer support is the stuff of Legends - quick and happy to engage, offering support and accepting suggestions. More documentation will make this App worth 6 stars.

Great app, subtle things that I don't like are being fine tuned. Development strikes me as passionate about quality so I don't expect constant changes overnight but well thought and meaningful changes. In other words probably just going to keep getting better. The app is already so rich in features as it is now.

One of the main issue of this app it is unable to link with weather system due to which it always notify to water your plant irrespective of the weather condition in you area. Please link this app with weather forcasting system.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your review! Having the app connected to a weather system would indeed be convenient. I hope to include this in the app in the future.

content: Best garden app ever. Whenever I've had questions or issues the developer has responded within a day or two and has been able to offer solutions. I tell everyone interested in gardening about this app. Every time I've shown them the app they seem genuinely impressed with all the features. Thanks Gardroid.
Great app, worth the upgrade for more plants. Grea visualisation of planting! Would love if different australian zones were put in rather than just southern hemisphere

i give an email, no feedback. it need to update. lack of many type of asian vegetable. no water spinach, cassava... please update or i will continually give 1 star untill it be update or i get refund my money back.
I am enjoying it so far. Wish they had a way to add other plants not on their list.
replyContent: Thanks for your review Rachael! You can add your own plants in the "My plants" screen. There you can either choose to create a new plant or to edit an existing one. Good luck!

content: Pretty good apps. Thank you for this apps. But can i know what is Average soil, Poor soil means? Im new to gardening. Thmks

Just downloaded this, looks great so far and very useful for what I want to do. Although I did notice I could find a certain flower in the database called Dianthus or Sweet William. Any chance you could add it please? üòä
Awsome app great organizer
Its a fantastic app. I would love to give it 5 stars but it is missing the most important plant in the app, Marijuana is needed and it will be 5 star üòÅ

Tried the free version for about three weeks and found it very easy to use, before upgrading to premium. Would say the premium is harder to try and navigate due to having way more features but well worth it. Only complaint would be lack of instructions with the premium version

Awesome, just what I needed. Upgraded to pro and lost my entire garden but that's ok didnt take long to re enter the data as I only have a small garden, so if you have a large garden make sure its backed up before upgrading.
So far so good

I really do love this app!!! It is very detailed which give you some ideas what to prepare for the plant. I just wish you will still add some new plants, new tips and new app features that would really help those novice gardeners (like me) to enjoy gardening. I just can't wait to see some developments in this app.
All and exactly what you need for household vegetables garden.
A find the App very good, reason why upgrade to premium. It is relativly simple to work. A tutorial would be welcome! :)
replyContent: Hi Joao, thanks for your review! You can change the harvest time by adjusting the harvest alert of a plant. The app will take that alert into account. You can find the alerts by selecting a plant in "My garden" and tapping on the alarm icon on the top right of your screen. You may always send me a mail of you have other questions.

content: Fine when it works! The app keeps loosing its settings and when restoring it does not work
replyContent: Hi Osiel, thanks for your review! Strange that the app looses its setting. Can you please contact me via mail so I can help you out further? Thanks in advance!

content: Pretty good app, the best I have found so far so bought premium. One question with garden beds though, if I use the fill option to add several plants in the garden , the bed menu still only reads as one plant. Is there a way to update to say, 16 plants without individually adding tomato 16 times and cluttering up the plants menu? Also, as the units are not representative of actual measurements (I am treating 1 square as a meter), there doesn't seem to be a way to account for smaller crops
replyContent: Hi Dean, thanks for your review! Currently there is no way to have 16 plants in a bed and see them as one in the plants menu. I show it as one plant so you can easily water all those plants. The tiles in the Garden screen don't have a unit so you can use them however you like. One square meter, one row, etc. in order to give you more freedom.

content: I don't normally rate my apps, but i downloaded like 5 different ones only to have them not be what i needed. I had to get the premium of this one for it to meet my needs, but it's a good app.

From what i see, seems a great app, however, Southern Hemisphere is a large a diverse area, be great to be able to select location by GPS or at least have a setting for average local temp/rainfall etc.

userName: Get Your Feel Good Back! B Jones
content: I have the premium version and I still get ads. There is absolutely no support at all whatsoever.
replyContent: Hi, have you installed the Premium version of the app? It is the one with the yellow icon, the free one has the green icon. I haven't received any question from you before, sorry if I have missed something. What support do you want? You may always contact me via mail, I'll be happy to help you out further.

content: Not quite suitable for Australia. I was hoping for more of a schedule.
replyContent: Hi Trabia, thanks for your review! Most of the info contains of average values that are applicable for most regions. Be sure to check the "Southern Hemisphere" in the Settings screen to have the calendars adapt their self to your region. What more would you like to see in the app?

content: Very useful for your garden activities and watering
I liked this app but Is this app is useful for indian climate and location?
replyContent: Hi Shivesh, thanks for your review! The app contains average values that apply to most regions. If you want to be sure if a plant will grow in your region. then you can compare your climate with a U.S. Hardiness Zone. Just be sure to protect your plants from the sun if temperatures become too high and make sure they have enough water.

content: Where's kangkung? Please add tropical vegetables?

This app is great for my garden. Only suggestion is keeping track of when the plants were last watered in addition to when to water next. Might find a different app. Paid for this app and lost everything.

missing alot of important veg, fruit, flower and herbs. would love more to be added

content: Veggies Herbs Fruits and Flowers Hundreds of choices each one Rich with information, deeper Information with a single tap and the (i) icon offer even more Care and Advice which is great. content: Very limited database of plants. There are a lot of common vegetables, fruits and flowers that you can't find in the database, e.g. blueberry, cauliflower, bush beans, etc. Half of the plants I grow on my garden are not listed. I regret paying for the premium version.

content: A really good app for planning and keeping track of a vegetable garden. love that I can include planting dates, get reminders for planting/watering and that it gives a gives a guide on harvest time. also got great help from the designer when I was suck.
replyContent: Hi Melissa, thanks for your review! I'm glad that I could help you out.

content: Love this! almost exactly what I'm looking for. A few suggestions: when planting a new plant, is there a way to adjust harvest date by # of days instead of calendar day? Also I can't change a garden bed without deleting a plant; wish I could change where a plant is. I use containers and I move them around to catch the sun.
replyContent: Hi Taylor, thanks for your review! Currently you can only change the harvest date by picking a new date from the calendar indeed. I'll look into adjusting it with amount of days. You can move plants or beds by long pressing them. For a bed, a popup window will appear where you can adjust the bed further. Good luck with growing your plants!

content: Nice application
Works well enough.

I've tried the free version and moved to premium.. I loved it.. The app is extremely useful, however I think the flowers collection is limited and couldn't find min & max temperatures info except for vegetables only (it's very important to know it for all plants not just vegetables; temperatures are high where I live and not all plants can tolerate that)

Thanks for this app. I am starting gardening and this is very good for me. I would like to see in this app : If you plant a carrot or whatever you can choose the amount of carrots in the bed instead of adding them 1 by 1. But 5 star App well done. It pays to listen to your customers
replyContent: Hi Wimpie, thanks for your review! You can fill up a bed with a plant by zooming out on the Garden screen until you see "Bed overview" in the top right corner. Long press on a bed and a popup window will show up where you'll find the "Fill up" button. Choose a plant from the list and define the area where the plant should be added on that bed.

content: tried free one and im quite savvy. but 2 questions, i see frost dates and planting time, im in Indonesia, forget about frost dates cuz theres no winter here, im curious about planting time, is it still relevant to be my reference? im new to planting, just starting.
replyContent: Hi Firman, thanks for your review! The frost dates won't be relevant to you indeed. Just make sure to protect the plants from the heat of the sun if necessary and keep an eye to the climate for the upcoming period.

content: Great app. But mising wasabi? :(

content: Hi, I purchased the veggie/fruit version, but the planting dates don't match with my growing zone 7.  I  tried to switch to another zone to see if it was just that one, but the dates don't change when the zone is changed. Is there something I'm doing wrong or is there a bug? Thanks.
replyContent: Hi Lynn, the planting dates are average values which might differ from your growing zone indeed. I'm busy with providing more detailed information, so the app will adjust itself to your region. The zones will just filter out plants that aren't suitable for that zone. For now I would suggest to check your weather and start the plants accordingly.

content: I only took ONE step in using this app and its already a joke. When setting bed sizes I have no idea what unit of measure is being used. English? Metric? Inches? Meters? Feet? Who cares right?! Its just arbitrary numbers. lol The length also doesn't go above "30" (my beds are 50feet) and no half measures for width, even though 2.5ft wide beds are a long established vegetable garden standard in the Americas and Europe. These are very simple things to know and design for.........
replyContent: Hi Katy, please let me explain the intention of the numbers. I didn't want to restrict the garden planner to a specific size like metrics or inches. Instead you're free to choose which format you like to use with them. I would recommend to place every row of plants in a row of tiles. Please contact me via mail so I can help you out further.

content: Great help for the forgetful gardener. I like the premium option to add your own plants. It allows me to fully customize the growth cycle to my own selection of crops.

Exetrimly easy, useful & straight forward app. I relied on it for all my work in my garden and roof farm. Thank you very much.

Great app, simple to use and has most functions for the home/hobby gardener. Would like to see some functions expanded for a lifestyle horticulturalist but those would be more in-depth and advanced. Well done!

simple way.

to suggestions. I'm glad I found a simple app to help me manage my garden.

content:
What a great app for anyone into gardening. I've tried many similar apps 
but they dont have the vegetables and herbs selections that this apps 
offers when you buy the premium version. It's well worth the price. Can't 
wait for future updates and new features (eg: syncing between other 
devices, etc). Keep up the good work.
Despite all my attempts, the app refused to even open. Very disappointed.
replyContent: Hi Jacque, sorry to see that the app is not opening. Please make sure that you are connected to the internet the first time, so the app can download all the plants from the server. Are you seeing any kind of message showing up? If you contact me via email, I can help you out further. It's hookah.smoka@gmail.com . Thanks in advance!

content: love the app. helps keep my garden on track.

I like the app. It's pretty straightforward and easy to use. I'd love to 
see Forget-me-nots added to the flowers section!
replyContent: Hi Nate, thank you for your review! Great to see that the app suits you well. I've added Forget-me-nots to the list of flowers for you, good luck growing them!

content:
Overall a helpful app and developer is clearly responsive and capable. My 
main critique of the app is around the UX. It just requires lots of tapping 
to get to helpful info. Like when viewing your vegetables, you're several 
taps away from the tips for the plant, and those are just little icons to 
show very basic information about it. If you want to see helpful tips, you 
need to navigate to a separate section, and that doesn't even include any 
extensive instruction. If this app just consolidated a lot of the features 
it has to be quicker to access, I would use it much more. When I have 
numerous vegetables in my garden, it takes up an annoying amount of time to 
get the info I need and often find just googling stuff can be quicker.

Grate app, the only thing missing is a list of pests the plant attracts and 
repels. Definitely worth buying for the mapping layout alone, not to 
mention the added plant libraries which I assume are still being compleated 
as they don't have the companion and fow lists yet. Over all a wonderful 
app well worth buying.
replyContent: Hi Chris, thanks for your review! I'm planning to add pests to the app so you know which plants might be affected by a certain pest. Not all companions or foes are known to the app yet, but I'll keep on updating the plants. Are you seeing some companions and foes, for example for potato? If not, please contact me via mail. Thanks in advance!

content: This is a very helpful app and it is easy to use. I really like the integration of calendar. I would like to see more vegetables and herds added. Keep up the good work.  Still a great app but what's happened to the Companions and Foes. I don't see them anymore. I've got the Premium version, is this function gone or is it just me?
I don't pay for apps but loved it so much I paid for the premier version.

Solid app for tracking the plants in it's database. Also let's you map your 
beds out.

Best garden related app ever to me!  Definitely worth getting the premium.  Need to remember though that what's saved in the non-premium version isn't automatically transferred to the premium version once opting it.  Fortunately I haven't done much in the non-premium version.    A lot of the awesome features in the premium version are seriously under-advertised.  I felt like winning the lottery after I realized that I could do so much more once I started experiencing the premium version.  My only question: does the app have a website too?
replyContent:
Thank you for your review! I'm glad the Premium version is so useful for you!
You can backup and restore your data from the free to the Premium version in the Settings menu, but I'm looking for better ways. There isn't a website yet for Gardroid, but there are plans to create one so you can access everything on multiple devices! Happy gardening!

content:
I have used the free version of the app during the previous two seasons. 
This year, I bought the premium - it's simple, effective and informative, 
and I plan to use it as the only organizing tool for my garden(s). I never 
leave reviews, and this is the first app I payed for. I don't even pay for 
computer software usually.... Keep up the good work :)
replyContent: Thank you for your first review and buying the Premium version Frederik! I'm proud to see that Gardroid helped you out over several growing seasons already! More features and plants are on their way, hopefully they will help you even out further with organizing your garden. Enjoy the app and good luck with growing your crops!

content: Not very intitutive to use. Can't remove a plant from my list that I accidentally 'planted' just so I can see how to play around with application.
replyContent: Hi Nora, thanks for your review! You can easily remove a plant by swiping it away from the list, or by tapping that plant, hit the tree dots on the upper right and select "Delete" from the menu. If you got any more questions, you may always ask me via hookah.smoka@gmail.com. Happy gardening!

content: On the surface, this is a nice package of tools. Its a decent plant scheduler, but a poor garden modeler. Simple things are made complicated by attempting to be a robust garden app. It falls short of that mark for virtually any kind of gardening. Overall i found the ui and tools cumbersome to use, making my most used options extremely difficult to get to. Thats fine if youre growing one thing, not so much if youre trying to build a robust garden.
replyContent: Hi there, sorry to see that you find the app complicated. Do you want to share which tasks are cumbersome or what is difficult to perform? That way I can improve the app so it will suit your workflow better. You may always contact me via hookah.smoka@gmail.com. Thanks in advance!

content: It would have given a 5 star but some of the features are questionable.  There is no clear description on how to use the garden bed layout feature. It has a option to add notes to your plants but you can't save the notes,,, not sure if it's a glitch or the app has not fully been developed...  The variety and information about plants is awesome but app still needs work,  A tutorial for some of the features would be good
replyContent:
Hi Mason, you can place a bed on the garden and plant crops on these beds. Zoom out and long press a bed to edit it.
Just type your note and hit return or the return arrow on the top left, the note will automatically be saved! More plante are on their way.
You may always send me an email so I can help you out further, it's hookah.smoka@gmail.com!

content: This is the best gardening app. Very flexible, but 'how to' is not always evident. If you think it doesn't have a feature, then its probably because you haven't found it!
I rarely take time to review, I rrely purchase the the premium version, worth it.
This app is great for gardening of all types

Valuable app with all the plant information I need in one place. Previously, I've used a number of websites,  Carl Emery's Country Living encyclopedia and  seed packet information to build a master spreadsheet of all my seeds and plant info. This app really helped cut down my planning time this season. Also appreciate the helpful tips under the Information button. I'm impressed. Thanks!
Fantastic app! My go to for gardening info!
Perfect! ‚ù§

Have used it for years. Very helpful, beautifully designed, and easy to use garden app!  But how do you permanently delete an entry in "My Plants" that you no longer want? I don't see a delete option, only an edit option. UPDATE: EXCELLENT support! Thank you for getting back and answering my question so fast! Best garden journal organization app out there! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
replyContent: Hi Willow, thanks for the review and your kind words! Awesome that Gardroid helped you out for over all those years! You can delete an entry by swiping it away from the list on the "My Plants" screen. I shall include a delete option as well on the plant details page. Good luck with growing your crops and enjoy Gardroid for all the years to come!

content: Really good app helps alot

I like the app but the addition of grains like wheat, barley, oats, buckwheat, and sorghum would really round this app off as a perfect, convenient one stop shop for gardeners. EDIT: I noticed the addition of many cereal grains and I'm very impressed üòÅ
replyContent: Hi Harry, thanks for your review! I shall add more grains to the Gardroid, so the app can help you out even further. You will get notified when they are available. Happy gardening!

content: I love this app it helps me not to over water my plants i would like though to see more herbs in app like coriander i could not find or kuri pumpkin / Hokkaido which im growing in my garden
replyContent: Hi Mariska, thanks for your review! I'm sure your plants will be happy with the water alerts as well. Coriander is already in the app, but it's named cilantro. More plants will be added to Gardroid, I will make sure to add kuri pumpkin too for you. Happy gardening!

content: I think this app is helpful but i wish i could see the start day. When i click on ths start, water button it says just planted.. :/
replyContent: Hi Samantha, thank you for your review! I'm not sure if I understand it correctly, but you can see the start date after you've planted a plant. Just tap on a plant in "My garden" and it shows you the start date and estimated harvest date on the details screen of that plant. Please contact me via email if I'm wrong or you want some more information.

content: Paid for premium after an hour of playing with free version. Love the companion planting info, ability to add strains, include plants not listed. Dimitri very helpful with any problems and open to suggestions. Think I will enjoy this a lot!
Can you also add flowers in the list? App can be also improved for Indian Subcontinent specific vegetable and herbs
replyContent: Hi Dharmesh, thanks for your review! Flowers are on their way and will be added soon to the app. If you have any suggestions regarding plants you would like to see in the app, please send me an email and I will include them for you. Good luck with growing your crops!

content: Edited...  Undecided...  It works  Potential is there. Just need a few bit touches and I'll lost them here;  1. I can't create a second garden - waiting for the upgrade to do that. Now I have downloaded the app on two devices. 2. When using metric system, it doesn't tell me about what units am I using - for example, I have a 9 x 4m garden which I have divided into beds. The beds are made into strips of 0.5 metres x 4m. I currently can't make a half metre bed by a specific area 3. I can't edit the beds once created and added to garden.  Looking forward your upgrades to make this functional    Regards
replyContent: Hi there, thanks for your feedback! The ability to create a second garden is not there yet indeed, but I shall add it later on. The numbers next to the bed are to indicate the row/column of the grid, rather than indicating the distance in meters. It is indeed not possible to split a tile in two unfortunately...

content: EDIT: after the lighting quick response by the Dimitri, turns out my phone the pixel wasn't working with the app properly, which they fixed in under 4 hours. I've had longer waits for medical appointments. I'm excited to recind my previous review, and my hunt for a truly versatile gardening app is done. It offers not only all the information you could want, but since I can edit it to my varieties and specific growing plans this will be my master gardening plan! When people care about their product they create great things, like this. Thank you!  I thought this was going to be the app I was looking for, hence why I bought yesterday full features. Works well except that I want to edit the days to harvest and germination that are different for each of my varieties (which can vary widely and I need a more exact reminder) but every time I go to add a new plant by editing a current one the app crashes on me. I sent feedback about a week ago with no reply or fix yet so I'll have to keep looking. If you want something like all the other apps that just give you info this is great, but I'm looking for something more.
replyContent: Hi Alison, I'm sorry to read that you can't edit an existing plant. I haven't received an email from you, can you please check that you've send the mail to hookah.smoka@gmail.com? Please do so I can help you out further and fix the problem for you. I hope Gardroid will be the app you're looking for after we've worked out this problem.

content: Awesome app that keeps improving with new features. Very customizable to end user. Good response from author.
Its one of the best gardening apps but it would be even better if there was a setting where you would be able to change the location as i do not live in the US. Thanks.
Would be nice if info on fruit trees like Jackfruit or soursop are added.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for using Gardroid! I've added jackfruit and soursop to the app, they will appear in the list of fruits. Hopefully they will be useful for you. Good luck growing those fruit trees!

content: It would be good if when planting within "My Beds" you can toggle on/off the suitable option. Otherwise anything slightly out of season needs the setting's changing to make them visible. (Maybe individual options for each garden?) Love the work so far!
replyContent: Hi Neb, thanks for your rating! I'm glad you love the app! Toggling the Suitable option when picking a plant would indeed be very handy. I shall include this option in a future update. Enjoy Gardroid!

content: Cool app...
So far so good however do not see spinich on the list
replyContent: Hi Steven, thank you for the review! Spinach should be in the list of vegetables. Can you check if you haven't turned on "Suitable for my garden" option in the Settings menu? This might filter out some plants like spinach. Otherwise you may always send me an email to hookah.smoka@gmail.com so I can help you further!

content: Love this app. Would give it 5 stars (or more if possible) if it weren't for the easily but accidental deletion of a plant. Sometimes, and thankfully not often, when I tap on a plant the app acts as if I swiped it to the left to delete it from the garden. I suggested an update that would fix or delete the issue by  replacing it with the option of selecting and holding the plant for a second and then be given the choice to delete the plant or not. All that said, I can find no other app that compares to this one. Thanks Hookah.

Hello, can you make the icons and images be saved offline in the app? because after cleaning the phones.. all icons and images gone and i need internet to reupload all over again (i dont know some of the plants.. so i need images and the icons for identification)
Great for helping you plan out your garden, but you will have to use different zoning info. The data in this app contradicts itself and is often inaccurate, at least for zone 9.
replyContent: Hi there, sorry to see that the info is inaccurate for you. Can you let me know which data contradicts itself via email? This will help me to improve the information. Thanks in advance!

content: Best gardening app I've used so far. Super helpful!! Looks great and has a lot of info. Highly recommend it!
Good app but some fruits and herbs Not found .
replyContent: Hi Faruk, you may always send me an email if you're looking for any plants. I will be glad to add them for you to Gardroid. Happy gardening!

content: I have tried quite a few gardening apps. I was looking for something that provided some helpful insight into things like planting times, and length of germination, as well as the abilty to organize what I had planted where. This is by far the best! Gives good basic plant info, in nicely quick view format. Now has the abilty to layout bed sizes and plant locations in bed as well as bed locations relative to each other in an overall garden. If you like gardening, take some time to learn how to use this app. It is worth it.
Best garden app for veg and herbs five stars now you have added raised bed keep up good work. Thomas young
replyContent: Thanks for the rating Thomas, it is much appreciated! I'm glad the raised beds get to good use by you. Enjoy the new functionalities and have a great harvest!

content: Great but missing basics. First off: In My Garden after I select each plant I need to go back to add to add a new vegetable. I have 10+ veggies and this takes a lot of time. No export available. Not easy to get to plant details from My garden. Overall great app but missing crucial practicality.
replyContent: Hi Turgan, thanks for the review. I will look into planting a batch of plants. You can export your garden in the Settings. If you press the image of the crops you've planted, you will be navigated to the plant details page. Please let me know via email if you looking for something else in the app. Good luck with growing your crops!

content: Easy, complete, helpful
Useful app.   Easy access to plant info and ability to keep good records.   Would be nice to record plants' physical location within garden.
replyContent:
Hi Brian, thanks for the review! I've added a feature where you can place your plants on your virtual garden in the app.  It is available in the latest release of Gardroid. What you think of it?

Hopefully this will help you further with managing your garden!

content: I tried several gardening apps and decided to purchase the premium version of Gardroid because it was the most useful. This app made it easy for me to keep track of the seeds sown as well as watering.
One Of The Best Simple & Ease To Use. It does needed a bigger data base.

I would very much like to be able to select my country (outside USA), select the environment (indoors, outdoors, since I grow everything in my balcony, in containers)  and also have LOVAGE in my list of herbs...
replyContent: Hi Christina-Monica, thanks for the review. The info in the app is applicable for most areas. You can compare your climate with an U.S. Hardiness zone to help determine which plants will thrive best in your region. I shall include a container option to the Location dropdown of the Settings and add lovage to the list of herbs. Happy gardening!

content: I really like this app. Tried some others but none came close to ease of use. I'm not a professional gardener by any stretch of the word, but this app gets me one step closer. If you have any type of a garden then you should give this a try.

This is my second year using the app. Really helps me keep track of alot of info in one place. Being able to add your own plants is super useful! This year I added Aunt Molly's Ground Cherry and Black Nightshade. For my peppers I just rename and use the standard info provided. I have recommended it to a few friends.
replyContent: Hi Milicent, welcome back! Great to hear that Gardroid helped you with your garden that much. More useful features are on their way, hopefully they will aid you even further with your garden. Have a great harvest!

content: Absolutely love the updates, however can only seem to add 15 plants to the "My Plants" section? Would love to be able to add more as I definitely have more than 15 :)
replyContent: Hi Kate! There is no restriction on how many plants you can add to "My Garden", so you should be able to add more than 15 plants to it. Can you please contact me via email so I can help you out further? The email address is hookah.smoka@gmail.com . Thanks in advance!

content: Gardening was never this easy!
replyContent: Glad to hear that Thomas! Enjoy the app and have a great harvest!

content: Awesome app. 2 suggestions from me. 1) when you have selected a plant from your garden you should be able to get info from clicking the picture rather than menu->plant info. 2) days since planted would be really handy so i can see if my seeds should he germinating now without having to work it out. Cheers! Also region stuff :) suede is suede rutabaga! Same for corriander:)
replyContent: Hi Jon, thanks for your review and your suggestions! I'm glad you like the app. I will include your requested features in the app. Once I have the resources I will provide more region based information. Happy gardening!

content: Had this for a while and have really liked it. But dropped my rating as I have just planted a load of veg and basically none of it is on the app. French beans, mangetout, birds eye chillis, habanero.
replyContent: Hi Katie, I'm sorry to see that you couldn't find the plants you were looking for. Habanero has been recently added. You can find French beans as green beans and mangetout as snap peas. Bird eye chillis aren't available yet but I will include it for you. If you want any other plant in the app, please contact me via email. Thanks in advance!

content: Please create update. The icon/photos for plants are no longger showing up. This is for the paid full version.     Update: Thank you,  yes the images are back!
replyContent: Hi Copper Cherry, there were some issues with the images lately but they should be fixed by now. Can you please let me know if the images are appearing in your app now? Thanks in advance!

content: Love it great buy

Great app I've just bought the full version so do pardon if my comments aren't up to date. I think it'll be more useful if the home screen displayed my garden per calendar. Also when I click into the individual plants I've got to go into the info for it to display the most important analysis I want. I've got different species of peppers which I plant in the greenhouse in the UK and I can't select indoor preference for them, also doesn't take into account the higher temperature needed for hotter chilies. I love the app still thanks for this.
Love the app. Images are not loading right now in the app. Not sure what's going on. Otherwise good.
replyContent: Hi Ryan, thank you for your review! It seems like there was something wrong with the server hosting he images. Can you please try again and let me know if the images are loading properly now for you? Thanks in advance!

content: Just bought this app, but struggling as I've added notes and pressed save and they've disappeared. Basic functionality not working ..
replyContent: Hi Linda, sorry to hear that your notes have disappeared. Can you please contact me via email so I can help you out? It is hookah.smoka@gmail.com. Thanks in advance!

content: From backyard gardening to experimental urban farms, this is a great tool for anyone who looks after plants.

Love this app. Only have had a few minutes using it but I know from all the other good reviews this will be the only needed app for my garden needs. Anyway you can make a widget for this app? It would be useful to have a widget up plants that needed attention.
replyContent: Hi Amouree, thank you for your review! I'm glad to see that Gardroid will assist you with your garden. A widget would indeed be very handy to get a quick overview of your current plants, I will provide it in the app for you. Happy gardening!

content: It's a very good app to keep your garden monitored, it had all I needed and the support team replies quickly. Only one flaw: it does not sync with another phone, you cannot transfer your data to a new phone. Edit 12/10/16: the support team fixed the backup data issue.

Went for the paid version because it is worth supporting. Best gardening app in the Play Store. Like how it includes the seasons for the southern hemisphere. Does not deserve the 1 star ratings some people are giving it. Would be nice to have some tips for pest control in the future. Keep up the good work!
replyContent: Thank you for supporting Gardroid and your kind words! Glad to see that the app has been useful for you. Pest control is on the to-do list, so you can expect more info about pest control in the future. Happy gardening!

content: nice app
Excellent app, and dedicated developer. A small tutorial could help, or startup tips for features such as the ability to long press an icon for a tooltip, otherwise can't really fault it.
replyContent: Hi Alex, thank you for the review! The app is suitable for most gardens worldwide. You can adjust the schedule in the settings of the app depending on which hemisphere you're living. About which planting dates are you referring? Please contact me via email so I can help you out further. Happy gardening!

content: When it gets data sharing between different machines using same app, will be 5* Right now is pointless typing same data 3 times to make it work.

A great app to keep track of my vegetables and herbs sowing date. But it could have been better if I could add multiple sowing/planting date for the same herb/vegetables. (I sow beets every month from the beginning of the season till September for continuous harvest, but the app doesn't allow to add another sowing date , it just changes the first one and i lose all data of the first one )
replyContent: Hi Nishi, thank you for supporting the app! I'm glad you like it that much! The idea was to add a new plant to your garden when you sow another batch of a specific plant. I'm working on a better way to log the progress of the plants, hopefully this will solve your needs. Have a great beet harvest!

content: I upgraded from the free to the paid app and had to add my plants from memory. Today I reset my phone and now I have to try and remember dates. Would be great if you could save all your plants so you don't have to do all that.
replyContent: Hi Tiffin, thanks for supporting Gardroid! I'm working on a way to save your garden so that this issue won't bother you. Hopefully this doesn't brought too much trouble for you. Happy gardening!

content: The Best Gardening App

Love this app!!  I upgraded from the free version to get the additional features! Very useful for my vegetable gardening needs!   The developer is very responsive to answering your questions and comments!  That in itself is a plus in my book!  Keep up the good work!

This app is really useful especially when I'm at the allotment and don't have my laptop! To deal with successional sowing I just create another plant (I am showing 3 lots of corn) I'm also blown away by the service, if you give feedback/ask a question you get feedback and they even engage in email conversations to ensure they understand what you need. I also love the reminders to water my plants. I would give this 10 stars if I could!!

It's awesome. Had an issue with it once but whatever it was it's working fine now. Great app. Has plenty of great info on most plants. Great for beginners and planning your garden. A must have if guidance or reference. Definitely worth every penny. Thanks for making this.
replyContent: Hi there, I'm sorry to hear that there is a problem with the vegetables that are not loading. Can you please contact me via email so I can help you out further? Thanks in advance!

content: I got the premium version because fruits and herbs are in this version. I really like how the calendar lets you know what to do with the plants and when. That's exactly what I was looking for! The information icons have great tips. Thanks!!!
replyContent: Hi Rose, sorry to hear that the plants are not showing up for you. Probably something went wrong when saving them on your device. Restarting the app will reload the plants to the app. The calendar for herbs is not added because you can sow and harvest them mostly anytime. Please contact me via email so I can help you out further. Thanks in advance!

content: And when I mark it as watered, it tells me that I am killing my plants with too much water! I want my money back. I'm going to Uninstall it now, I only had it for maybe 2 weeks!
replyContent: Hi Carol, sorry to hear that the watering is not working properly. If your own added plants are asking for water, can you set their water needs again and see if that fixes the issue? Please contact me via email so I can help you out further. Thanks in advance!

content: Friendly and approachable with ideas. Great app with a growing amount of plants and the information that you need. Would be great to have common deficiencies and disease what they look like for plants would be great addition. Also would love to see labels with the icons that depict the information for each plant. Also front page should have a smaller quote and larger image it just seem odd to have a small quote for the large area. Perhaps there is a weather spot going here with rainfall and humidity, etc.
I enjoy. I updated to premium.   I like new update where you can edit plant name. Now i can also add my own plants. Love thia app. Good job.
Love this app! Tracks when you plant and has great information about the plants in your garden.

This is the best, most useful Gardening App I've ever had! In the past, I've  had to use three different apps to monitor my garden. Now, I only need one! I've also never had a developer respond to my emails and actually incorporate my suggestions so quickly before. If I could give this app 10 stars, I would because the developer deserves 5 stars too!
replyContent: Thank you for your rating and the extra starts Sabrina, I'm glad I could help you out! Happy gardening!

content: Quick response to emails & added an herb that wasn't in their database. Took only a day! üòä Thank You for a great app! Well worth the money! Keep up the good work..
It can't find any plants on the app. Doesn't work on the Galaxy S7.
replyContent: Hi Olvier, sorry to hear that. Can you please contact me through email so we can find a solution what might causes this? Thanks in advance!

content: Works great but still needs a lot more plants added.  Flowers aren't in at all, and a lot of common vegetables are missing.  Hopefully they add more.  Luckily you can add custom plants if you like.
replyContent: Hi Alex, thank you for your review! More plants will become available over time, including flowers which will be available soon. Happy gardening!

content: There was already a wide variety of plants to choose from, deeply informative, and many options and alarms, and now you can add your own plants the app doesn't have! Now the entire garden won't be forgotten! Thanks again, Hookah Smoka, for not only creating a fantastic app, but for being so responsive and helpful!
Detailed allotment assistant. Simple icons help to describe perfect growing conditions. Lists both companion plants and foes. You can even link to your Gmail calendar. I recommend to any novice.
Would like to see an option to go from the items in 'my garden' to the specific info about the crop. Then it would get my 5 star rating
replyContent: Hi Floris, this feature is now available in the app. Once you've selected a plant from "My Garden", you can press the menu button on the top right and select "Plant info" This guides you to the info page of that crop. Hope you like it!

content: Hi there! I really like the app and I've bought the premium version (why didn't you include the sync option?). I have a few suggestions. Would it be possible to add my location? I thing that just the hemisphere of the Earth is not really specific enough - and especially if one is having an outdoor garden.  Also, can you implement the weather conditions? That's kind of connected with the request for a location. More plants or the option to add custom plants wouldn't hurt either.
replyContent: Hi Goiko, thanks for supporting Gardroid! Adding custom plants will be available in the next version, which will be released in a couple of days. When I've found a good weather provider, it will be included in the app so you can set your location as well. A sync option is also on the todo list, sorry for the inconvenience for now. Happy gardening!

content: Love the information it provides visually and the reminders too. Hope to see more plants added including common annual and perennial flowers
Just wish there were flowers! And,or save your own information and pics. This gets rid of sooo much paper! Love this!
replyContent: Thanks for the review Moon Flower! Flowers will be included in the future and adding your own plants will be soon available. Happy gardening!

content: Such an amazing app, should hands down be front page. Something that matters!

Tried out a few different apps and this one best fits my needs. Reminds me of when to plant inside and outside. First harvest days. And when to water amongst other info. Plus it doesn't ask me to find the pictures for the plants.

For keeping track of basic plant facts and tips in a simple, elegant, and pleasant-to-use interface, I've found nothing better. It has all of the common types of plants and even a few rare ones; the one major suggestion I can make is to add more plants to make it a more comprehensive reference guide.

Its an easy to read app with timers and notifications installed on the app for watering and harvesting.  Just wish it had the ability to add plants manually to the databank.  I find this would make this app perfect if you guys did so.
replyContent: Hi Zachary, thanks for your review! Currently the feature to add your own plants is being developed, so you can expect it in an upcoming release. Happy gardening!

content: Hope to see options concerning  Greenhouses in the future. This app allows easy record of planting, harvest and much more. Extremely helpful in aggressive crop rotation in my hydroponic greenhouse. Being able to track and record cloning would be helpful as well.

I downloaded the free app first and had already added plants to my garden, then I decided to by this one to have more options. I would give it 5 stars if it had sync option, and more plants to choose from!

I just got a community garden plot and I wanted an app to help me figure out when to plan what in my area. I love that it also tells me how far a part to plant things. I looked at the trial version and knew it was just what I wanted, so I bought the full version.
Starting a small vegetable garden. This app is a great tool. Gives you most of the things you need to know to get a good yield.
I used to have a garden with my grandparents and this is helping me remember and learn. I just wish it had more vegetables like squash or zucchini and a way to find out our ph and hardiness zone
replyContent: Thanks for your review Tammy. I'm glad the app is helping you out! More vegetables will become available over time.  If you want, you may send an email so I can help you out further about the pH and hardiness zone. Happy gardening!

content: Won't even open. Refund requested.
replyContent: Dear Stacey, when opening the app for the first time, you will need to have a active network connection so the plants can be downloaded to your device. Have you checked this? Please send an email so I can help you further.

content: I love all of the tips. For starting the plants and managing them throughout their harvest I've not seen a better app.  (I rarely give out 5 stars to apps)
Believe it or not it's the only app I have and will ever need

This is the best app you can get if you are serious about starting your own herb/fruit/vegetable garden. This app tells you EVERYTHING, from water needs to PH levels and type of soil you need to use. I love it! First I downloaded the free version and like one minute after (no kidding) I bought the premium version as soon as I saw it said it had info about herbs and fruits!!! Amazing! This app has been made with love. Thank you! Exactly what I needed. :)

Downloaded on a whim and thoroughly impressed. This app seems extremely comprehensive for the aspiring urban farmer. I did note that the Herbs don't have plant dates recommended, but I'm sure those might be coming along? (Unless my understanding of how herbs work is incorrect?)

Excellent app. Everything you need in just one look. Nothing to compare with those with extensive texts!! Just looking forward to find information about roots depth (for container planting) and plants height (to avoid shadows between them).
replyContent: Thank you for the review Trinidad! The roots depth and plants height are on their way, so you'll find that info soon in the app. Happy gardening!

content: Great app!

I love that I can learn and track the progress of my garden with the extensive amount of varieties. Maybe in the future some IMO gardening tips. Also add peppercorn, squash and zucchini. Couldn't find that. Mahalo!
Very simple and easy to understand. A very good variety of plants to choose from. Everything keeps getting better with this. I just found the zone hardiness filter in settings, very helpful!
replyContent: Thank you for your review! I was also thinking about an option like that, so you can expect it in the upcoming weeks. Happy gardening!

content: This app has tons of information on the plants and also has companion planting information as well. I can't wait for new plants to be added.
I would give a 4 1/2. Love it. Mel
How do I do my garden in the app?  Please help me out
replyContent: Thank you for the review! You can add crops to your garden by pressing the plant icon in the top right corner on the details page of a crop. Happy gardening!

content: I really like all the great information on this app.  It would be really great to see more information such as. -Indoor Sowing times -Seedling optimal temperature range -Germination times
Well put together, easy to understand interface. Lots of great tips for the beginner gardener. Please add more vegetables and herbs though! Scallions aka green unions would be great :)

The app is one of the best that I have had. I would just like to see more herbs and vegetables in it. I really like that when I click the harvest button that it goes directly to my google calendar. It is really good organised. I like it.
